section.section:
A buyer may cancel a preneed burial contract as to preneed goods not delivered or preneed services not performed if the buyer:
permanently moves more than 75 miles from the cemetery specified in the preneed burial contract; and
gives to the seller written notice, under oath, of the move and includes the buyer's new permanent address.

In that event:
the seller shall certify to the trustee:
the trustee shall then pay to the buyer the remaining specific funds and accrued interest.

Notwithstanding subsection (a) of this section, by written notice, a buyer may cancel the purchase of a casket or casket vault under a preneed burial contract at any time prior to the time the buyer needs the casket or casket vault for burial.

In that event:
the seller shall certify to the trustee:
the trustee shall pay to the buyer the specific funds and interest accrued on those funds; and
in addition to the refund paid by the trustee, the seller shall pay to the buyer an amount of money necessary to provide the buyer with a refund of 100% of the money paid for the casket or casket vault under the preneed burial contract.

text.section:
If a buyer fails to provide written notice of cancellation and defaults on a preneed burial contract and, as a result, the seller terminates the preneed burial contract:
the seller shall certify to the trustee:
the default and termination of the preneed burial contract;
the amount of the specific funds; and
the reasonable expenses of the seller; and
the trustee shall then pay:
to the buyer, those specific funds and accrued interest, less the reasonable expenses of the seller; and
to the seller, the reasonable expenses of the seller.

If specific funds on deposit in a trust account have been dormant for at least 50 years since the date of the last deposit or disbursement and the seller cannot locate the buyer:
the seller shall certify to the trustee:
that the trust account is dormant and the buyer cannot be located; and
the amount of the specific funds; and
the trustee shall then pay to the seller those specific funds and accrued interest.
